content.description: Thin face past a bolt leads into a thin crack which quickly widens to hand size and ends at anchors atop the formation. Walk-off.
content.location:
Located 50 feet right of

Ritten on the Wall

on a separate buttress behind a large pine tree.

climbs.name: Tongue Buckler
climbs.fa: Chris Miller, Chuck Scott, Pete Paredes & Loren Scott, August 2003

content.description: Awkward starting moves gain a vertical face which soon transitions into a right-facing corner under a small roof. Pull the roof and finish on positive but exposed-feeling moves to anchors. Short and enjoyable.
content.location:
Located on the left of the two main rocks, and just left of

Follow Your Dike

, a right-slanting dike system.

content.description: Climb the steep slab/face past a gear placement between the second and third bolt. Shares anchors with the climb to the right.
content.location:
Located on the left side of the formation right of

Follow Your Dike

, and just left of

A Wrinkle in Time

.

content.description: Follow the obvious left leaning crack on the right side.  Crux is the chimney squeeze.
content.protection: Large gear for the chossy chimney, but good pro to 2" starting midway.  Bolts directly above, but no hangers.  (!)  If TRing off neighboring anchors to left, need directionals up high.
content.location: Downclimb the lichen crusted holds on the back.

climbs.name: Hairy Eyeball
climbs.fa: Pete Paredes, Loren Scott, Chuck Scott & Chris Miller, August 2003

content.description:
Climbs the somewhat dirty crack to face just left of

Ritten on the Wall

. Not especially inspiring, but perhaps it will clean up some with traffic. Not a bomb, but no stars.

Boulder up and onto the dike, and then follow it via sometimes balancy and interesting moves to an exciting and runout finish, contemplating all the while how solidly the holds are attatched to the wall. Gear belay and walk off or rap from anchors atop Tongue Buckler.
content.location:
Located on the left of the two main formations and just right of

Tongue Buckler

up an obvious right-slanting dike system.

climbs.name: A Wrinkle in Time
climbs.fa: Loren Scott, Pete Paredes & Chris Miller, September 2003

content.description: Mantle onto a small ledge to start, then continue over a small roof which leads to thin face climbing and the anchors. The crux on this is near the top as you climb direct, and if you find the key hold you will understand where the name came from!
content.location:
Just right of

Ritten on the Wall

.
